title: Spanish for Heritage Speakers
description: Focus on the grammatical, cultural and linguistic needs of Spanish speakers in the United States who have not had formal study of the language. Emphasis on morphological, lexical and cultural understanding of the Spanish language. Designed to prepare students for upper-division Spanish coursework in language and culture. Not open to students with credit in SPANÂ 203. 3 lectures, 1 activity. Fulfills USCP. Formerly SPAN 123.
prerequisites: SPAN 202 or appropriate score on placement exam or consent of instructor
